br.span:
Mount Vernon City Schools Board of Education Meeting for April 20, 2020 was livestreamed from the Board Office Monday evening. The meeting can be accessed via a ‘Youtube Live’ broadcast embedded on the district's website. While the public has access to viewing the meeting, public participation was not possible at this time. Your comments and concerns are important to us so please feel free to email them to Superintendent Bill Seder at bseder@mvcsd.us .
April Board of Education Meeting Live-streamed
April 20, 2020 6:00 pm from the Board of Education Office. 1080p

I wish I could have said April Fools' Day to the recent news from Governor DeWine that “Schools will be closed through May 1st.” Unfortunately, the news is true and we will continue to provide remote/online learning to our students for the Month of April. Please read the Parent Update 4/3/2020 for more information.
Individual questions can be addressed to my attention via my email bseder@mvcsd.us .
PARENT UPDATE 3/27/2020
PARENT UPDATE 3/20/2020
PARENT UPDATE 3/17/2020
PARENT UPDATE 3/15/2020
PARENT UPDATE 3/14/2020

Mount Vernon City Schools Open enrollment applications for the 2020-2021 school year will be accepted online only. The online application form for new open enrollment will be available to be completed and submitted beginning April 1, 2020. New Open Enrolled Students will be required to enroll through the online registration process. Click Read More link for details.

a.title: Continuing Open Enrollment written on chalkboard.

img.title: Continuing Open Enrollment written on chalkboard.
img.alt: Continuing Open Enrollment written on chalkboard.

td.span: Continuing Open Enrollment for the 2020-2021 School Year

span.div: Continuing Open Enrollment is for students who are currently attending Mount Vernon School District and desire to continue open enrollment with the District for the 2020-2021 school year. Complete your application through the Parent Portal on the District web site. Instructions for Continuing Open Enrollment are located on the Parent Resources Page. Currently open enrolled students will have until April 10 to complete this process. If your address has changed since your last application, please update your child's emergency medical form in the Parent Portal on the District web site and you will also need to provide proof of residency. Instructions for Change of Address are also located on the Parent Resource Page.

div.a: Letter from Superintendent William Seder Jr.

span.div: If you have any questions concerning Continuing Open Enrollment, please contact Terry Streby tstreby@mvcsd.us or contact John Frye jfrye@mvcsd.us .

a.title: Students raising hands to answer question.

img.title: Students raising hands to answer question.
img.alt: Students raising hands to answer question.

div.div: Due to the COVID 19 situation, the Kindergarten registration process has changed for the 2020-2021 school year. The home attendance area building will now call parents to schedule an appointment during the summer months. Registration appointments will begin in August.
div.a: Click link for Kindergarten Registration Instructions.

span.div: Please call your home attendance area building or registrar, Deb Doup. idedoup@mvcsd.us 740.397.7422 x 6000 if you have questions.

td.a: Ohio Medicaid School Program Annual Notice

span.div: The Mt Vernon City School District has the opportunity to receive Federal Medicaid dollars through a program called the Ohio Medicaid School Program (MSP). Through this program, school districts can receive Medicaid dollars for services such as Speech, Audiology, Physical Therapy, Occupational Therapy, Nursing, Psychology, Counseling, and Social Work services. Read More... for program details.

Our mission is to provide, in cooperation with the larger community, a quality education for all students by upholding a standard of excellence in curriculum, staff, facilities, achievement and conduct and to graduate individuals empowered to be self-motivated, life-long learners and responsible citizens.
